Container.Name: Youtarr
Container.Overview: An application to automate downloading of Youtube videos for Plex https://github.com/DialmasterOrg/Youtarr https://hub.docker.com/r/dialmaster/youtarr/

Config.Name: Config
Config.Description: Stores Youtarr persistent config and files. Youtarr expects the container path to be /app/config, but the other value can be wherever you want to store the persistent configs in your UNRAID setup.

Config.Name: Youtube Video Data
Config.Description: The location where Youtarr will download videos. Leave the container path as /data/, this is only for internal use by Youtarr

Config.Name: IN_DOCKER_CONTAINER
Config.Description: Required for UNRAID. Do not modify.

Config.Name: DATA_PATH
Config.Description: Internal path for media storage inside Youtarr container. Must match the container path defined in the Youtube Video Data mapping

Config.Name: DB_HOST
Config.Description: The host address of your MariaDB instance. Likely the best option is to use the LAN IP of your UNRAID instance, eg, 192.168.X.X

Config.Name: DB_PORT
Config.Description: The port for your MariaDB instance

Config.Name: DB_USER
Config.Description: The user for your MariaDB instance. This must already exist in your MariaDB instance and have full read/write access for your Youtarr DB.

Config.Name: DB_NAME
Config.Description: The name of your Youtarr DB in MariaDB.

Config.Name: Youtarr port mapping
Config.Description: The external port where Youtarr will be available on UNRAID

Config.Name: AUTH_PRESET_USERNAME
Config.Description: The username to be used to authenticate/login to Youtarr

Config.Name: AUTH_PRESET_PASSWORD
Config.Description: The initial password to be used to login to Youtarr. You can change this later in the Youtarr UI.
